Package: org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs

[Groovy] Class URI

    • org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.URI

    • Holds a URI that has not been located on the virtual file system

      Authors:
      Schalk W. Cronj√©

          Creates a URL from a URL string.

      • Constructor Detail

        • URI(java.lang.String s)

          Creates a URL from a URL string. As an extension to normal URI syntax, this will also accept a URI with a VFS-style encoded password i.e. ftp://ysb33r:{D7B82198B272F5C93790FEB38A73C7B8}@127.0.0.1/path As a further extension to the query string part, any part in the form vfs.SCHEME.PROPERTY will be removed from the URI and interpreted as a VFI provider property

          Parameters:
          String

        • URI(java.io.File f)

          Creates a URL from a local file A relative file will be normalised to an absolute file path

          Parameters:
          File

        • URI(FileName f)

          Creates a URL from a VFS FileName object

          Parameters:
          f - A VFS FileName object

      • Method Detail

        • URI addProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object> properties)

          Add extra VFS properties. Any non-matching properties will be ignored.

          Parameters:
          properties
          Since:
          1.0

        • URI div(java.lang.CharSequence childPath)

          Allows a child path to be appended to an existing URI. Additional query parameters or fragments are not allowed and will result in an exception.

          Returns:
          A new path with the child path appended. All non-VFS query string parameters will remain intact and all existing properties will be inherited.
          Parameters:
          childPath - Relative path to be appended.
          Since:
          1.0
          Throws:
          URIException if additional query parameters or fragments are found.

        • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object>> getProperties()

          Returns all of the parsed properties

          a map in
